resource.purpose: Data Elements are defined for each element to assist in questionnaire construction etc

element.short: Event occurs frequency times per period
element.definition: The number of times to repeat the action within the specified period / period range (i.e. both period and periodMax provided).
element.meaningWhenMissing: If no frequency is stated, the assumption is that the event occurs once per period, but systems SHOULD always be specific about this

resource.name: Timing.repeat.frequencyMax
resource.title: Timing.repeat.frequencyMax
resource.purpose: Data Elements are defined for each element to assist in questionnaire construction etc

element.short: Event occurs up to frequencyMax times per period
element.definition: If present, indicates that the frequency is a range - so to repeat between [frequency] and [frequencyMax] times within the period or period range.

resource.name: Timing.repeat.period
resource.title: Timing.repeat.period
resource.purpose: Data Elements are defined for each element to assist in questionnaire construction etc

element.short: Event occurs frequency times per period
element.definition: Indicates the duration of time over which repetitions are to occur; e.g. to express "3 times per day", 3 would be the frequency and "1 day" would be the period.

resource.name: Timing.repeat.periodMax
resource.title: Timing.repeat.periodMax
resource.purpose: Data Elements are defined for each element to assist in questionnaire construction etc

element.short: Upper limit of period (3-4 hours)
element.definition: If present, indicates that the period is a range from [period] to [periodMax], allowing expressing concepts such as "do this once every 3-5 days.

resource.name: Timing.repeat.periodUnit
resource.title: Timing.repeat.periodUnit
resource.purpose: Data Elements are defined for each element to assist in questionnaire construction etc

element.short: s | min | h | d | wk | mo | a - unit of time (UCUM)
element.definition: The units of time for the period in UCUM units.

binding.description: A unit of time (units from UCUM).

resource.name: Timing.repeat.dayOfWeek
resource.title: Timing.repeat.dayOfWeek
resource.purpose: Data Elements are defined for each element to assist in questionnaire construction etc

element.short: mon | tue | wed | thu | fri | sat | sun
element.definition: If one or more days of week is provided, then the action happens only on the specified day(s).
element.comment: If no days are specified, the action is assumed to happen every day as otherwise specified. The elements frequency and period cannot be used as well as dayOfWeek.

resource.name: Timing.repeat.timeOfDay
resource.title: Timing.repeat.timeOfDay
resource.purpose: Data Elements are defined for each element to assist in questionnaire construction etc

element.short: Time of day for action
element.definition: Specified time of day for action to take place.
element.comment: When time of day is specified, it is inferred that the action happens every day (as filtered by dayofWeek) on the specified times. The elements when, frequency and period cannot be used as well as timeOfDay.

resource.name: Timing.repeat.when
resource.title: Timing.repeat.when
resource.purpose: Data Elements are defined for each element to assist in questionnaire construction etc

element.short: Code for time period of occurrence
element.definition: An approximate time period during the day, potentially linked to an event of daily living that indicates when the action should occur.
element.comment: When more than one event is listed, the event is tied to the union of the specified events.
element.requirements: Timings are frequently determined by occurrences such as waking, eating and sleep.

binding.description: Real world event relating to the schedule.

resource.name: Timing.repeat.offset
resource.title: Timing.repeat.offset
resource.purpose: Data Elements are defined for each element to assist in questionnaire construction etc

element.short: Minutes from event (before or after)
element.definition: The number of minutes from the event. If the event code does not indicate whether the minutes is before or after the event, then the offset is assumed to be after the event.

resource.name: Timing.code
resource.title: Timing.code
resource.purpose: Data Elements are defined for each element to assist in questionnaire construction etc

element.short: BID | TID | QID | AM | PM | QD | QOD | Q4H | Q6H +
element.definition: A code for the timing schedule (or just text in code.text). Some codes such as BID are ubiquitous, but many institutions define their own additional codes. If a code is provided, the code is understood to be a complete statement of whatever is specified in the structured timing data, and either the code or the data may be used to interpret the Timing, with the exception that .repeat.bounds still applies over the code (and is not contained in the code).
element.comment: BID etc. are defined as 'at institutionally specified times'. For example, an institution may choose that BID is "always at 7am and 6pm".  If it is inappropriate for this choice to be made, the code BID should not be used. Instead, a distinct organization-specific code should be used in place of the HL7-defined BID code and/or the a structured representation should be used (in this case, specifying the two event times).

binding.description: Code for a known / defined timing pattern.

resource.name: CodeableConcept.coding
resource.title: CodeableConcept.coding
resource.purpose: Data Elements are defined for each element to assist in questionnaire construction etc

element.short: Code defined by a terminology system
element.definition: A reference to a code defined by a terminology system.
element.comment: Codes may be defined very casually in enumerations, or code lists, up to very formal definitions such as SNOMED CT - see the HL7 v3 Core Principles for more information.  Ordering of codings is undefined and SHALL NOT be used to infer meaning. Generally, at most only one of the coding values will be labeled as UserSelected = true.
element.requirements: Allows for translations and alternate encodings within a code system.  Also supports communication of the same instance to systems requiring different encodings.

resource.name: CodeableConcept.text
resource.title: CodeableConcept.text
resource.purpose: Data Elements are defined for each element to assist in questionnaire construction etc

element.short: Plain text representation of the concept
element.definition: A human language representation of the concept as seen/selected/uttered by the user who entered the data and/or which represents the intended meaning of the user.
element.comment: Very often the text is the same as a displayName of one of the codings.
element.requirements: The codes from the terminologies do not always capture the correct meaning with all the nuances of the human using them, or sometimes there is no appropriate code at all. In these cases, the text is used to capture the full meaning of the source.

mapping.map: C*E.9. But note many systems use C*E.2 for this

resource.name: ParameterDefinition.name
resource.title: ParameterDefinition.name
resource.purpose: Data Elements are defined for each element to assist in questionnaire construction etc

element.short: Name used to access the parameter value
element.definition: The name of the parameter used to allow access to the value of the parameter in evaluation contexts.

resource.name: ParameterDefinition.use
resource.title: ParameterDefinition.use
resource.purpose: Data Elements are defined for each element to assist in questionnaire construction etc

element.short: in | out
element.definition: Whether the parameter is input or output for the module.

binding.description: Whether the parameter is input or output

resource.name: ParameterDefinition.min
resource.title: ParameterDefinition.min
resource.purpose: Data Elements are defined for each element to assist in questionnaire construction etc

element.short: Minimum cardinality
element.definition: The minimum number of times this parameter SHALL appear in the request or response.

resource.name: ParameterDefinition.max
resource.title: ParameterDefinition.max
resource.purpose: Data Elements are defined for each element to assist in questionnaire construction etc

element.short: Maximum cardinality (a number of *)
element.definition: The maximum number of times this element is permitted to appear in the request or response.

resource.name: ParameterDefinition.documentation
resource.title: ParameterDefinition.documentation
resource.purpose: Data Elements are defined for each element to assist in questionnaire construction etc

element.short: A brief description of the parameter
element.definition: A brief discussion of what the parameter is for and how it is used by the module.

resource.name: ParameterDefinition.type
resource.title: ParameterDefinition.type
resource.purpose: Data Elements are defined for each element to assist in questionnaire construction etc

element.short: What type of value
element.definition: The type of the parameter.

binding.description: A list of all the concrete types defined in this version of the FHIR specification - Abstract Types, Data Types and Resource Types

resource.name: ParameterDefinition.profile
resource.title: ParameterDefinition.profile
resource.purpose: Data Elements are defined for each element to assist in questionnaire construction etc

element.short: What profile the value is expected to be
element.definition: If specified, this indicates a profile that the input data must conform to, or that the output data will conform to.

resource.name: MarketingStatus.country
resource.title: MarketingStatus.country
resource.purpose: Data Elements are defined for each element to assist in questionnaire construction etc

element.short: The country in which the marketing authorisation has been granted shall be specified It should be specified using the ISO 3166 ‑ 1 alpha-2 code elements
element.definition: The country in which the marketing authorisation has been granted shall be specified It should be specified using the ISO 3166 ‑ 1 alpha-2 code elements.

resource.name: MarketingStatus.jurisdiction
resource.title: MarketingStatus.jurisdiction
resource.purpose: Data Elements are defined for each element to assist in questionnaire construction etc

element.short: Where a Medicines Regulatory Agency has granted a marketing authorisation for which specific provisions within a jurisdiction apply, the jurisdiction can be specified using an appropriate controlled terminology The controlled term and the controlled term identifier shall be specified
element.definition: Where a Medicines Regulatory Agency has granted a marketing authorisation for which specific provisions within a jurisdiction apply, the jurisdiction can be specified using an appropriate controlled terminology The controlled term and the controlled term identifier shall be specified.

resource.name: MarketingStatus.status
resource.title: MarketingStatus.status
resource.purpose: Data Elements are defined for each element to assist in questionnaire construction etc

element.short: This attribute provides information on the status of the marketing of the medicinal product See ISO/TS 20443 for more information and examples
element.definition: This attribute provides information on the status of the marketing of the medicinal product See ISO/TS 20443 for more information and examples.

resource.name: MarketingStatus.dateRange
resource.title: MarketingStatus.dateRange
resource.purpose: Data Elements are defined for each element to assist in questionnaire construction etc

element.short: The date when the Medicinal Product is placed on the market by the Marketing Authorisation Holder (or where applicable, the manufacturer/distributor) in a country and/or jurisdiction shall be provided A complete date consisting of day, month and year shall be specified using the ISO 8601 date format NOTE “Placed on the market” refers to the release of the Medicinal Product into the distribution chain
element.definition: The date when the Medicinal Product is placed on the market by the Marketing Authorisation Holder (or where applicable, the manufacturer/distributor) in a country and/or jurisdiction shall be provided A complete date consisting of day, month and year shall be specified using the ISO 8601 date format NOTE “Placed on the market” refers to the release of the Medicinal Product into the distribution chain.

resource.name: MarketingStatus.restoreDate
resource.title: MarketingStatus.restoreDate
resource.purpose: Data Elements are defined for each element to assist in questionnaire construction etc

element.short: The date when the Medicinal Product is placed on the market by the Marketing Authorisation Holder (or where applicable, the manufacturer/distributor) in a country and/or jurisdiction shall be provided A complete date consisting of day, month and year shall be specified using the ISO 8601 date format NOTE “Placed on the market” refers to the release of the Medicinal Product into the distribution chain
element.definition: The date when the Medicinal Product is placed on the market by the Marketing Authorisation Holder (or where applicable, the manufacturer/distributor) in a country and/or jurisdiction shall be provided A complete date consisting of day, month and year shall be specified using the ISO 8601 date format NOTE “Placed on the market” refers to the release of the Medicinal Product into the distribution chain.

resource.name: SubstanceAmount.amount[x]
resource.title: SubstanceAmount.amount[x]
resource.purpose: Data Elements are defined for each element to assist in questionnaire construction etc

element.short: Used to capture quantitative values for a variety of elements. If only limits are given, the arithmetic mean would be the average. If only a single definite value for a given element is given, it would be captured in this field
element.definition: Used to capture quantitative values for a variety of elements. If only limits are given, the arithmetic mean would be the average. If only a single definite value for a given element is given, it would be captured in this field.

resource.name: SubstanceAmount.amountType
resource.title: SubstanceAmount.amountType
resource.purpose: Data Elements are defined for each element to assist in questionnaire construction etc

element.short: Most elements that require a quantitative value will also have a field called amount type. Amount type should always be specified because the actual value of the amount is often dependent on it. EXAMPLE: In capturing the actual relative amounts of substances or molecular fragments it is essential to indicate whether the amount refers to a mole ratio or weight ratio. For any given element an effort should be made to use same the amount type for all related definitional elements
element.definition: Most elements that require a quantitative value will also have a field called amount type. Amount type should always be specified because the actual value of the amount is often dependent on it. EXAMPLE: In capturing the actual relative amounts of substances or molecular fragments it is essential to indicate whether the amount refers to a mole ratio or weight ratio. For any given element an effort should be made to use same the amount type for all related definitional elements.

resource.name: SubstanceAmount.amountText
resource.title: SubstanceAmount.amountText
resource.purpose: Data Elements are defined for each element to assist in questionnaire construction etc

element.short: A textual comment on a numeric value
element.definition: A textual comment on a numeric value.

resource.name: SubstanceAmount.referenceRange.lowLimit
resource.title: SubstanceAmount.referenceRange.lowLimit
resource.purpose: Data Elements are defined for each element to assist in questionnaire construction etc

element.short: Lower limit possible or expected
element.definition: Lower limit possible or expected.

resource.name: SubstanceAmount.referenceRange.highLimit
resource.title: SubstanceAmount.referenceRange.highLimit
resource.purpose: Data Elements are defined for each element to assist in questionnaire construction etc

element.short: Upper limit possible or expected
element.definition: Upper limit possible or expected.

resource.name: ElementDefinition.path
resource.title: ElementDefinition.path
resource.purpose: Data Elements are defined for each element to assist in questionnaire construction etc

element.short: Path of the element in the hierarchy of elements
element.definition: The path identifies the element and is expressed as a "."-separated list of ancestor elements, beginning with the name of the resource or extension.

resource.name: ElementDefinition.representation
resource.title: ElementDefinition.representation
resource.purpose: Data Elements are defined for each element to assist in questionnaire construction etc

element.short: xmlAttr | xmlText | typeAttr | cdaText | xhtml
element.definition: Codes that define how this element is represented in instances, when the deviation varies from the normal case.
element.comment: In resources, this is rarely used except for special cases where the representation deviates from the normal, and can only be done in the base standard (and profiles must reproduce what the base standard does). This element is used quite commonly in Logical models when the logical models represent a specific serialization format (e.g. CDA, v2 etc.).

binding.description: How a property is represented when serialized.

resource.name: ElementDefinition.sliceName
resource.title: ElementDefinition.sliceName
resource.purpose: Data Elements are defined for each element to assist in questionnaire construction etc

element.short: Name for this particular element (in a set of slices)
element.definition: The name of this element definition slice, when slicing is working. The name must be a token with no dots or spaces. This is a unique name referring to a specific set of constraints applied to this element, used to provide a name to different slices of the same element.
element.comment: The name SHALL be unique within the structure within the context of the constrained resource element.  (Though to avoid confusion, uniqueness across all elements is recommended.).
element.requirements: May also be used for code generation purposes.

resource.name: ElementDefinition.label
resource.title: ElementDefinition.label
resource.purpose: Data Elements are defined for each element to assist in questionnaire construction etc

element.short: Name for element to display with or prompt for element
element.definition: A single preferred label which is the text to display beside the element indicating its meaning or to use to prompt for the element in a user display or form.
element.comment: See also the extension (http://hl7.org/fhir/StructureDefinition/elementdefinition-question)[extension-elementdefinition-question.html].

resource.name: ElementDefinition.code
resource.title: ElementDefinition.code
resource.purpose: Data Elements are defined for each element to assist in questionnaire construction etc

element.short: Corresponding codes in terminologies
element.definition: A code that has the same meaning as the element in a particular terminology.
element.comment: The concept SHALL be properly aligned with the data element definition and other constraints, as defined in the code system, including relationships, of any code listed here.  Where multiple codes exist in a terminology that could correspond to the data element, the most granular code(s) should be selected, so long as they are not more restrictive than the data element itself. The mappings may be used to provide more or less granular or structured equivalences in the code system.
element.requirements: Links the meaning of an element to an external terminology, and is very useful for searching and indexing.

binding.description: Codes that indicate the meaning of a data element.

resource.name: ElementDefinition.slicing.discriminator.type
resource.title: ElementDefinition.slicing.discriminator.type
resource.purpose: Data Elements are defined for each element to assist in questionnaire construction etc

element.short: value | exists | pattern | type | profile
element.definition: How the element value is interpreted when discrimination is evaluated.

binding.description: How an element value is interpreted when discrimination is evaluated

resource.name: ElementDefinition.slicing.discriminator.path
resource.title: ElementDefinition.slicing.discriminator.path
resource.purpose: Data Elements are defined for each element to assist in questionnaire construction etc

element.short: Path to element value
element.definition: A FHIRPath expression, using [the simple subset of FHIRPath](fhirpath.html#simple), that is used to identify the element on which discrimination is based.
element.comment: The only FHIRPath functions that are allowed are as(type), resolve(), and extension(url).

resource.name: ElementDefinition.slicing.description
resource.title: ElementDefinition.slicing.description
resource.purpose: Data Elements are defined for each element to assist in questionnaire construction etc

element.short: Text description of how slicing works (or not)
element.definition: A human-readable text description of how the slicing works. If there is no discriminator, this is required to be present to provide whatever information is possible about how the slices can be differentiated.
element.comment: If it's really not possible to differentiate them, the design should be re-evaluated to make the content usable.

resource.name: ElementDefinition.slicing.ordered
resource.title: ElementDefinition.slicing.ordered
resource.purpose: Data Elements are defined for each element to assist in questionnaire construction etc

element.short: If elements must be in same order as slices
element.definition: If the matching elements have to occur in the same order as defined in the profile.
element.comment: Order should only be required when it is a pressing concern for presentation. Profile authors should consider making the order a feature of the rules about the narrative, not the rules about the data - requiring ordered data makes the profile much less re-usable.
element.meaningWhenMissing: Order is not required unless specified

resource.name: ElementDefinition.slicing.rules
resource.title: ElementDefinition.slicing.rules
resource.purpose: Data Elements are defined for each element to assist in questionnaire construction etc

element.short: closed | open | openAtEnd
element.definition: Whether additional slices are allowed or not. When the slices are ordered, profile authors can also say that additional slices are only allowed at the end.
element.comment: Allowing additional elements makes for a much for flexible template - it's open for use in wider contexts, but also means that the content of the resource is not closed, and applications have to decide how to handle content not described by the profile.

binding.description: How slices are interpreted when evaluating an instance.

resource.name: ElementDefinition.short
resource.title: ElementDefinition.short
resource.purpose: Data Elements are defined for each element to assist in questionnaire construction etc

element.short: Concise definition for space-constrained presentation
element.definition: A concise description of what this element means (e.g. for use in autogenerated summaries).
element.comment: May change the term to provide language more appropriate to the context of the profile or to reflect slicing.

resource.name: ElementDefinition.definition
resource.title: ElementDefinition.definition
resource.purpose: Data Elements are defined for each element to assist in questionnaire construction etc

element.short: Full formal definition as narrative text
element.definition: Provides a complete explanation of the meaning of the data element for human readability.  For the case of elements derived from existing elements (e.g. constraints), the definition SHALL be consistent with the base definition, but convey the meaning of the element in the particular context of use of the resource.
element.comment: It is easy for a different definition to change the meaning of an element and this can have nasty downstream consequences. Please be careful when providing definitions.
element.requirements: To allow a user to state the usage of an element in a particular context.

resource.name: ElementDefinition.comment
resource.title: ElementDefinition.comment
resource.purpose: Data Elements are defined for each element to assist in questionnaire construction etc

element.short: Comments about the use of this element
element.definition: Explanatory notes and implementation guidance about the data element, including notes about how to use the data properly, exceptions to proper use, etc.
element.comment: If it is possible to capture usage rules using constraints, that mechanism should be used in preference to this element.

resource.name: ElementDefinition.requirements
resource.title: ElementDefinition.requirements
resource.purpose: Data Elements are defined for each element to assist in questionnaire construction etc

element.short: Why this resource has been created
element.definition: This element is for traceability of why the element was created and why the constraints exist as they do. This may be used to point to source materials or specifications that drove the structure of this element.
element.comment: This element does not describe the usage of the element (that's done in comments), rather it's for traceability of *why* the element is either needed or why the constraints exist as they do.  This may be used to point to source materials or specifications that drove the structure of this data element.

resource.name: ElementDefinition.alias
resource.title: ElementDefinition.alias
resource.purpose: Data Elements are defined for each element to assist in questionnaire construction etc

element.short: Other names
element.definition: Identifies additional names by which this element might also be known.
element.requirements: Allows for better easier recognition of the element by multiple communities, including international communities.

mapping.map: (Designatable_Item).designation.sign  acceptability!=preferred or context is other than default
RELATED NAMES (only some of these apply)

resource.name: ElementDefinition.min
resource.title: ElementDefinition.min
resource.purpose: Data Elements are defined for each element to assist in questionnaire construction etc

element.short: Minimum Cardinality
element.definition: The minimum number of times this element SHALL appear in the instance.

mapping.map: Minimum  size of  data element  values?

resource.name: ElementDefinition.max
resource.title: ElementDefinition.max
resource.purpose: Data Elements are defined for each element to assist in questionnaire construction etc

element.short: Maximum Cardinality (a number or *)
element.definition: The maximum number of times this element is permitted to appear in the instance.

constraint.human: Max SHALL be a number or "*"

mapping.map: Maximum  size of  data element  values?

resource.name: ElementDefinition.base.path
resource.title: ElementDefinition.base.path
resource.purpose: Data Elements are defined for each element to assist in questionnaire construction etc

element.short: Path that identifies the base element
element.definition: The Path that identifies the base element - this matches the ElementDefinition.path for that element. Across FHIR, there is only one base definition of any element - that is, an element definition on a [StructureDefinition](structuredefinition.html#) without a StructureDefinition.base.

resource.name: ElementDefinition.base.min
resource.title: ElementDefinition.base.min
resource.purpose: Data Elements are defined for each element to assist in questionnaire construction etc

element.short: Min cardinality of the base element
element.definition: Minimum cardinality of the base element identified by the path.
element.comment: This is provided for consistency with max, and may affect code generation of mandatory elements of the base resource are generated differently (some reference implementations have done this).

resource.name: ElementDefinition.base.max
resource.title: ElementDefinition.base.max
resource.purpose: Data Elements are defined for each element to assist in questionnaire construction etc

element.short: Max cardinality of the base element
element.definition: Maximum cardinality of the base element identified by the path.
element.comment: This is provided to code generation, since the serialization representation in JSON differs depending on whether the base element has max > 1. Also, some forms of code generation may differ.

resource.name: ElementDefinition.contentReference
resource.title: ElementDefinition.contentReference
resource.purpose: Data Elements are defined for each element to assist in questionnaire construction etc

element.short: Reference to definition of content for the element
element.definition: Identifies the identity of an element defined elsewhere in the profile whose content rules should be applied to the current element.

resource.name: ElementDefinition.type.code
resource.title: ElementDefinition.type.code
resource.purpose: Data Elements are defined for each element to assist in questionnaire construction etc

element.short: Data type or Resource (reference to definition)
element.definition: URL of Data type or Resource that is a(or the) type used for this element. References are URLs that are relative to http://hl7.org/fhir/StructureDefinition e.g. "string" is a reference to http://hl7.org/fhir/StructureDefinition/string. Absolute URLs are only allowed in logical models.
element.comment: If the element is a reference to another resource, this element contains "Reference", and the targetProfile element defines what resources can be referenced. The targetProfile may be a reference to the general definition of a resource (e.g. http://hl7.org/fhir/StructureDefinition/Patient).

binding.description: Either a resource or a data type, including logical model types

resource.name: ElementDefinition.type.profile
resource.title: ElementDefinition.type.profile
resource.purpose: Data Elements are defined for each element to assist in questionnaire construction etc

element.short: Profiles (StructureDefinition or IG) - one must apply
element.definition: Identifies a profile structure or implementation Guide that applies to the datatype this element refers to. If any profiles are specified, then the content must conform to at least one of them. The URL can be a local reference - to a contained StructureDefinition, or a reference to another StructureDefinition or Implementation Guide by a canonical URL. When an implementation guide is specified, the type SHALL conform to at least one profile defined in the implementation guide.

resource.name: ElementDefinition.type.targetProfile
resource.title: ElementDefinition.type.targetProfile
resource.purpose: Data Elements are defined for each element to assist in questionnaire construction etc

element.short: Profile (StructureDefinition or IG) on the Reference target - one must apply
element.definition: Used when the type is "Reference", and Identifies a profile structure or implementation Guide that applies to the target of the reference this element refers to. If any profiles are specified, then the content must conform to at least one of them. The URL can be a local reference - to a contained StructureDefinition, or a reference to another StructureDefinition or Implementation Guide by a canonical URL. When an implementation guide is specified, the target resource SHALL conform to at least one profile defined in the implementation guide.

resource.name: ElementDefinition.type.aggregation
resource.title: ElementDefinition.type.aggregation
resource.purpose: Data Elements are defined for each element to assist in questionnaire construction etc

element.short: contained | referenced | bundled - how aggregated
element.definition: If the type is a reference to another resource, how the resource is or can be aggregated - is it a contained resource, or a reference, and if the context is a bundle, is it included in the bundle.

binding.description: How resource references can be aggregated.

resource.name: ElementDefinition.type.versioning
resource.title: ElementDefinition.type.versioning
resource.purpose: Data Elements are defined for each element to assist in questionnaire construction etc

element.short: either | independent | specific
element.definition: Whether this reference needs to be version specific or version independent, or whether either can be used.
element.comment: The base specification never makes a rule as to which form is allowed, but implementation guides may do this.

binding.description: Whether a reference needs to be version specific or version independent, or whether either can be used

resource.name: ElementDefinition.defaultValue[x]
resource.title: ElementDefinition.defaultValue[x]
resource.purpose: Data Elements are defined for each element to assist in questionnaire construction etc

element.short: Specified value if missing from instance
element.definition: The value that should be used if there is no value stated in the instance (e.g. 'if not otherwise specified, the abstract is false').
element.comment:
Specifying a default value means that the property can never been unknown - it must always have a value. Further, the default value can never be changed, or changed in constraints on content models. Defining default values creates many difficulties in implementation (e.g. when is a value missing?). For these reasons, default values are (and should be) used extremely sparingly. 

No default values are ever defined in the FHIR specification, nor can they be defined in constraints ("profiles") on data types or resources. This element only exists so that default values may be defined in logical models.

resource.name: ElementDefinition.meaningWhenMissing
resource.title: ElementDefinition.meaningWhenMissing
resource.purpose: Data Elements are defined for each element to assist in questionnaire construction etc

element.short: Implicit meaning when this element is missing
element.definition: The Implicit meaning that is to be understood when this element is missing (e.g. 'when this element is missing, the period is ongoing'.
element.comment: Implicit meanings for missing values can only be specified on a resource, data type, or extension definition, and never in a profile that applies to one of these. An implicit meaning for a missing value can never be changed, and specifying one has the consequence that constraining its use in profiles eliminates use cases as possibilities, not merely moving them out of scope.

resource.name: ElementDefinition.orderMeaning
resource.title: ElementDefinition.orderMeaning
resource.purpose: Data Elements are defined for each element to assist in questionnaire construction etc

element.short: What the order of the elements means
element.definition: If present, indicates that the order of the repeating element has meaning and describes what that meaning is.  If absent, it means that the order of the element has no meaning.
element.comment: This element can only be asserted on repeating elements and can only be introduced when defining resources or data types.  It can be further refined profiled elements but if absent in the base type, a profile cannot assert meaning.

resource.name: ElementDefinition.fixed[x]
resource.title: ElementDefinition.fixed[x]
resource.purpose: Data Elements are defined for each element to assist in questionnaire construction etc

element.short: Value must be exactly this
element.definition: Specifies a value that SHALL be exactly the value  for this element in the instance. For purposes of comparison, non-significant whitespace is ignored, and all values must be an exact match (case and accent sensitive). Missing elements/attributes must also be missing.
element.comment: This is not recommended for Coding and CodeableConcept since these often have highly contextual properties such as version or display.

mapping.map: N/A (only relevant when constraining, which 11179 doesn't do)

resource.name: ElementDefinition.pattern[x]
resource.title: ElementDefinition.pattern[x]
resource.purpose: Data Elements are defined for each element to assist in questionnaire construction etc

element.short: Value must have at least these property values
element.definition: Specifies a value that the value in the instance SHALL follow - that is, any value in the pattern must be found in the instance. Other additional values may be found too. This is effectively constraint by example.  The values of elements present in the pattern must match exactly (case-sensitive, accent-sensitive, etc.).
element.comment: Mostly used for fixing values of CodeableConcept. At present, pattern[x] is not recommended as a basis for slicing while issues related to this are investigated during the STU period.

resource.name: ElementDefinition.example.label
resource.title: ElementDefinition.example.label
resource.purpose: Data Elements are defined for each element to assist in questionnaire construction etc

element.short: Describes the purpose of this example
element.definition: Describes the purpose of this example amoung the set of examples.

resource.name: ElementDefinition.example.value[x]
resource.title: ElementDefinition.example.value[x]
resource.purpose: Data Elements are defined for each element to assist in questionnaire construction etc

element.short: Value of Example (one of allowed types)
element.definition: The actual value for the element, which must be one of the types allowed for this element.

resource.name: ElementDefinition.minValue[x]
resource.title: ElementDefinition.minValue[x]
resource.purpose: Data Elements are defined for each element to assist in questionnaire construction etc

element.short: Minimum Allowed Value (for some types)
element.definition: The minimum allowed value for the element. The value is inclusive. This is allowed for the types date, dateTime, instant, time, decimal, integer, and Quantity.
element.comment: Except for date/date/instant, the type of the minValue[x] SHALL be the same as the specified type of the element. For the date/dateTime/instant values, the type of minValue[x] SHALL be either the same, or a a [Duration](datatypes.html#Duration) which specifies a relative time limit to the current time. The duration value is positive, and is subtracted from the current clock to determine the minimum allowable value.   A minimum value for a Quantity is interpreted as an canonical minimum - e.g. you cannot provide 100mg if the minimum value is 10g.

resource.name: ElementDefinition.maxValue[x]
resource.title: ElementDefinition.maxValue[x]
resource.purpose: Data Elements are defined for each element to assist in questionnaire construction etc

element.short: Maximum Allowed Value (for some types)
element.definition: The maximum allowed value for the element. The value is inclusive. This is allowed for the types date, dateTime, instant, time, decimal, integer, and Quantity.
element.comment: Except for date/date/instant, the type of the maxValue[x] SHALL be the same as the specified type of the element. For the date/dateTime/instant values, the type of maxValue[x] SHALL be either the same, or a a [Duration](datatypes.html#Duration) which specifies a relative time limit to the current time. The duration value is positive, and is added to the current clock to determine the maximum allowable value.   A maximum value for a Quantity is interpreted as an canonical maximum - e.g. you cannot provide 10g if the maximum value is 50mg.

resource.name: ElementDefinition.maxLength
resource.title: ElementDefinition.maxLength
resource.purpose: Data Elements are defined for each element to assist in questionnaire construction etc

element.short: Max length for strings
element.definition: Indicates the maximum length in characters that is permitted to be present in conformant instances and which is expected to be supported by conformant consumers that support the element.
element.comment: Receivers are not required to reject instances that exceed the maximum length.  The full length could be stored.  In some cases, data might be truncated, though truncation should be undertaken with care and an understanding of the consequences of doing so. If not specified, there is no conformance expectation for length support.

resource.name: ElementDefinition.condition
resource.title: ElementDefinition.condition
resource.purpose: Data Elements are defined for each element to assist in questionnaire construction etc

element.short: Reference to invariant about presence
element.definition: A reference to an invariant that may make additional statements about the cardinality or value in the instance.

resource.name: ElementDefinition.constraint.key
resource.title: ElementDefinition.constraint.key
resource.purpose: Data Elements are defined for each element to assist in questionnaire construction etc

element.short: Target of 'condition' reference above
element.definition: Allows identification of which elements have their cardinalities impacted by the constraint.  Will not be referenced for constraints that do not affect cardinality.

resource.name: ElementDefinition.constraint.requirements
resource.title: ElementDefinition.constraint.requirements
resource.purpose: Data Elements are defined for each element to assist in questionnaire construction etc

element.short: Why this constraint is necessary or appropriate
element.definition: Description of why this constraint is necessary or appropriate.
element.comment: To be used if the reason for the constraint might not be intuitive to all implementers.

resource.name: ElementDefinition.constraint.severity
resource.title: ElementDefinition.constraint.severity
resource.purpose: Data Elements are defined for each element to assist in questionnaire construction etc

element.short: error | warning
element.definition: Identifies the impact constraint violation has on the conformance of the instance.
element.comment: This allows constraints to be asserted as "shall" (error) and "should" (warning).

binding.description: SHALL applications comply with this constraint?

resource.name: ElementDefinition.constraint.human
resource.title: ElementDefinition.constraint.human
resource.purpose: Data Elements are defined for each element to assist in questionnaire construction etc

element.short: Human description of constraint
element.definition: Text that can be used to describe the constraint in messages identifying that the constraint has been violated.
element.comment: Should be expressed in business terms as much as possible.

resource.name: ElementDefinition.constraint.expression
resource.title: ElementDefinition.constraint.expression
resource.purpose: Data Elements are defined for each element to assist in questionnaire construction etc

element.short: FHIRPath expression of constraint
element.definition: A [FHIRPath](fhirpath.html) expression of constraint that can be executed to see if this constraint is met.
element.requirements: Used by validation tooling tests of the validity of the resource.

resource.name: ElementDefinition.constraint.xpath
resource.title: ElementDefinition.constraint.xpath
resource.purpose: Data Elements are defined for each element to assist in questionnaire construction etc

element.short: XPath expression of constraint
element.definition: An XPath expression of constraint that can be executed to see if this constraint is met.
element.comment: Elements SHALL use "f" as the namespace prefix for the FHIR namespace, and "x" for the xhtml namespace, and SHALL NOT use any other prefixes.     Note: we are considering deprecating the xpath element. Implementer feedback is welcome.
element.requirements: Used in Schematron tests of the validity of the resource.

resource.name: ElementDefinition.constraint.source
resource.title: ElementDefinition.constraint.source
resource.purpose: Data Elements are defined for each element to assist in questionnaire construction etc

element.short: Reference to original source of constraint
element.definition: A reference to the original source of the constraint, for traceability purposes.
element.comment: This is used when, e.g. rendering, where it is not useful to present inherited constraints when rendering the snapshot.

resource.name: ElementDefinition.mustSupport
resource.title: ElementDefinition.mustSupport
resource.purpose: Data Elements are defined for each element to assist in questionnaire construction etc

element.short: If the element must supported
element.definition: If true, implementations that produce or consume resources SHALL provide "support" for the element in some meaningful way.  If false, the element may be ignored and not supported.
element.comment: "Something useful" is context dependent and impossible to describe in the base FHIR specification. For this reason, tue mustSupport flag is never set to true by the FHIR specification itself - it is only set to true in profiles.     This is done in [Resource Profiles](profiling.html#mustsupport), where the profile labels an element as mustSupport=true. When a profile does this, it SHALL also make clear exactly what kind of "support" is required, as this can mean many things.    Note that an element that has the property IsModifier is not necessarily a "key" element (e.g. one of the important elements to make use of the resource), nor is it automatically mustSupport - however both of these things are more likely to be true for IsModifier elements than for other elements.
element.requirements: Allows a profile to set expectations for system capabilities beyond merely respecting cardinality constraints.

resource.name: ElementDefinition.isModifier
resource.title: ElementDefinition.isModifier
resource.purpose: Data Elements are defined for each element to assist in questionnaire construction etc

element.short: If this modifies the meaning of other elements
element.definition: If true, the value of this element affects the interpretation of the element or resource that contains it, and the value of the element cannot be ignored. Typically, this is used for status, negation and qualification codes. The effect of this is that the element cannot be ignored by systems: they SHALL either recognize the element and process it, and/or a pre-determination has been made that it is not relevant to their particular system.
element.comment: Only the definition of an element can set IsModifier true - either the specification itself or where an extension is originally defined. Once set, it cannot be changed in derived profiles. An element/extension that has isModifier=true SHOULD also have a minimum cardinality of 1, so that there is no lack of clarity about what to do if it is missing. If it can be missing, the definition SHALL make the meaning of a missing element clear.
element.requirements: Allows elements to be introduced into a specification that can't safely be ignored by applications that don't recognize them.
element.meaningWhenMissing: An element is not a modified element unless it is explicitly specified to be one

resource.name: ElementDefinition.isModifierReason
resource.title: ElementDefinition.isModifierReason
resource.purpose: Data Elements are defined for each element to assist in questionnaire construction etc

element.short: Reason that this element is marked as a modifier
element.definition: Explains how that element affects the interpretation of the resource or element that contains it.

resource.name: ElementDefinition.isSummary
resource.title: ElementDefinition.isSummary
resource.purpose: Data Elements are defined for each element to assist in questionnaire construction etc

element.short: Include when _summary = true?
element.definition: Whether the element should be included if a client requests a search with the parameter _summary=true.
element.comment: Some resources include a set of simple metadata, and some very large data. This element is used to reduce the quantity of data returned in searches. Note that servers may pre-cache summarized resources for optimal performance, so servers might not support per-profile use of the isSummary flag. When a request is made with _summary=true, serailisers only include elements marked as 'isSummary = true'. Other than Attachment.data, all data type properties are included in the summary form. Modifier elements or elements with minimum cardinality = 1 must be marked as summary elements.
element.requirements: Allow clients to search through large resources quickly.
element.meaningWhenMissing: An element is not included in the summary unless it is explicitly specified to be so

resource.name: ElementDefinition.binding.strength
resource.title: ElementDefinition.binding.strength
resource.purpose: Data Elements are defined for each element to assist in questionnaire construction etc

element.short: required | extensible | preferred | example
element.definition: Indicates the degree of conformance expectations associated with this binding - that is, the degree to which the provided value set must be adhered to in the instances.
element.comment: For further discussion, see [Using Terminologies](terminologies.html).

binding.description: Indication of the degree of conformance expectations associated with a binding.

resource.name: ElementDefinition.binding.description
resource.title: ElementDefinition.binding.description
resource.purpose: Data Elements are defined for each element to assist in questionnaire construction etc

element.short: Human explanation of the value set
element.definition: Describes the intended use of this particular set of codes.

resource.name: ElementDefinition.binding.valueSet[x]
resource.title: ElementDefinition.binding.valueSet[x]
resource.purpose: Data Elements are defined for each element to assist in questionnaire construction etc

element.short: Source of value set
element.definition: Points to the value set or external definition (e.g. implicit value set) that identifies the set of codes to be used. If the binding refers to an explicit value set - the normal case - then use a canonical(ValueSet) preferably containing the canonical URL for the value set. If the reference is to an implicit value set - usually, an IETF RFC that defines a grammar, such as mime types - then use a uri.
element.comment: For value sets with a referenceResource, the display can contain the value set description.  The reference may be version-specific or not.

mapping.map: points to explicit list or expression that evaluates to list of (Enumerated_Value_Domain).member

resource.name: ElementDefinition.mapping.identity
resource.title: ElementDefinition.mapping.identity
resource.purpose: Data Elements are defined for each element to assist in questionnaire construction etc

element.short: Reference to mapping declaration
element.definition: An internal reference to the definition of a mapping.

resource.name: ElementDefinition.mapping.language
resource.title: ElementDefinition.mapping.language
resource.purpose: Data Elements are defined for each element to assist in questionnaire construction etc

element.short: Computable language of mapping
element.definition: Identifies the computable language in which mapping.map is expressed.
element.comment: If omitted, then there can be no expectation of computational interpretation of the mapping.

binding.description: The mime type of an attachment. Any valid mime type is allowed.

resource.name: ElementDefinition.mapping.map
resource.title: ElementDefinition.mapping.map
resource.purpose: Data Elements are defined for each element to assist in questionnaire construction etc

element.short: Details of the mapping
element.definition: Expresses what part of the target specification corresponds to this element.
element.comment: For most mappings, the syntax is undefined.  Syntax will be provided for mappings to the RIM.  Multiple mappings may be possible and may include constraints on other resource elements that identify when a particular mapping applies.

mapping.map: ObjectClass, Property (this is one possible data model that can be mapped to - the uri would identify the data model  mappingSpecification.mappingScript

resource.name: ElementDefinition.mapping.comment
resource.title: ElementDefinition.mapping.comment
resource.purpose: Data Elements are defined for each element to assist in questionnaire construction etc

element.short: Comments about the mapping or its use
element.definition: Comments that provide information about the mapping or its use.

resource.name: SubstanceMoiety.role
resource.title: SubstanceMoiety.role
resource.purpose: Data Elements are defined for each element to assist in questionnaire construction etc

element.short: The role of the moiety should be specified if there is a specific role the moiety is playing
element.definition: The role of the moiety should be specified if there is a specific role the moiety is playing.

resource.name: SubstanceMoiety.identifier
resource.title: SubstanceMoiety.identifier
resource.purpose: Data Elements are defined for each element to assist in questionnaire construction etc

element.short: The unique identifier assigned to the substance representing the moiety based on the ISO 11238 substance controlled vocabulary
element.definition: The unique identifier assigned to the substance representing the moiety based on the ISO 11238 substance controlled vocabulary.

resource.name: SubstanceMoiety.name
resource.title: SubstanceMoiety.name
resource.purpose: Data Elements are defined for each element to assist in questionnaire construction etc

element.short: The name of the moiety shall be provided
element.definition: The name of the moiety shall be provided.

resource.name: SubstanceMoiety.stereochemistry
resource.title: SubstanceMoiety.stereochemistry
resource.purpose: Data Elements are defined for each element to assist in questionnaire construction etc

element.short: Stereochemistry shall be captured as described in 4.7.1
element.definition: Stereochemistry shall be captured as described in 4.7.1.

resource.name: SubstanceMoiety.opticalActivity
resource.title: SubstanceMoiety.opticalActivity
resource.purpose: Data Elements are defined for each element to assist in questionnaire construction etc

element.short: Optical activity shall be captured as described in 4.7.2
element.definition: Optical activity shall be captured as described in 4.7.2.

resource.name: SubstanceMoiety.molecularFormula
resource.title: SubstanceMoiety.molecularFormula
resource.purpose: Data Elements are defined for each element to assist in questionnaire construction etc

element.short: Molecular formula shall be captured as described in 4.7.3
element.definition: Molecular formula shall be captured as described in 4.7.3.

resource.name: SubstanceMoiety.amount
resource.title: SubstanceMoiety.amount
resource.purpose: Data Elements are defined for each element to assist in questionnaire construction etc

element.short: Used to capture quantitative values for a variety of elements. If only limits are given, the arithmetic mean would be the average. If only a single definite value for a given element is given, it would be captured in this field
element.definition: Used to capture quantitative values for a variety of elements. If only limits are given, the arithmetic mean would be the average. If only a single definite value for a given element is given, it would be captured in this field.

resource.name: ProductShelfLife.identifier
resource.title: ProductShelfLife.identifier
resource.purpose: Data Elements are defined for each element to assist in questionnaire construction etc

element.short: Unique identifier for the packaged Medicinal Product
element.definition: Unique identifier for the packaged Medicinal Product.

resource.name: ProductShelfLife.type
resource.title: ProductShelfLife.type
resource.purpose: Data Elements are defined for each element to assist in questionnaire construction etc

element.short: This describes the shelf life, taking into account various scenarios such as shelf life of the packaged Medicinal Product itself, shelf life after transformation where necessary and shelf life after the first opening of a bottle, etc. The shelf life type shall be specified using an appropriate controlled vocabulary The controlled term and the controlled term identifier shall be specified
element.definition: This describes the shelf life, taking into account various scenarios such as shelf life of the packaged Medicinal Product itself, shelf life after transformation where necessary and shelf life after the first opening of a bottle, etc. The shelf life type shall be specified using an appropriate controlled vocabulary The controlled term and the controlled term identifier shall be specified.

resource.name: ProductShelfLife.period
resource.title: ProductShelfLife.period

resource.name: BackboneElement.modifierExtension

element.short: Extensions that cannot be ignored
element.definition: May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the element and that modifies the understanding of the element in which it is contained. Usually modifier elements provide negation or qualification. To make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict set of governance applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer can define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension. Applications processing a resource are required to check for modifier extensions.
element.comment: There can be no stigma associated with the use of extensions by any application, project, or standard - regardless of the institution or jurisdiction that uses or defines the extensions.  The use of extensions is what allows the FHIR specification to retain a core level of simplicity for everyone.
element.isModifierReason: modifierExtension is reserved for use where modifier extensions must be used

element.short: generated | extensions | additional | empty
element.definition: The status of the narrative - whether it's entirely generated (from just the defined data or the extensions too), or whether a human authored it and it may contain additional data.

binding.description: The status of a resource narrative

resource.name: Narrative.div
resource.title: Narrative.div
resource.purpose: Data Elements are defined for each element to assist in questionnaire construction etc

element.short: Limited xhtml content
element.definition: The actual narrative content, a stripped down version of XHTML.
element.comment: The contents of the html element are an XHTML fragment containing only the basic html formatting elements described in chapters 7-11 and 15 of the HTML 4.0 standard, <a> elements (either name or href), images and internally contained stylesheets. The XHTML content SHALL not contain a head, a body, external stylesheet references, scripts, forms, base/link/xlink, frames, iframes and objects.

constraint.human: The narrative SHALL contain only the basic html formatting elements and attributes described in chapters 7-11 (except section 4 of chapter 9) and 15 of the HTML 4.0 standard, <a> elements (either name or href), images and internally contained style attributes
The narrative SHALL have some non-whitespace content
